intro: Babingtonia pinifolia, commonly known as the needle-leaved babingtonia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its needle-like leaves and showy, pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and is adapted to nutrient-poor soils. It is often found in coastal areas and can thrive in full sun. Babingtonia pinifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
